conclusion: Use the concept of work in thermodynamics for an isobaric process.
The process from state B to state C is at a constant pressure P = 0.6p0.
The volume changes from V0 (state B) to 0.5V0 (state C).
The work done by the gas during an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
Calculate ΔV as VC - VB = 0.5V0 - V0 = -0.5V0.
Substitute values into the work formula: W = 0.6p0 × (-0.5V0).
The negative sign indicates work is done on the gas (compression).
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is -0.3p0V0.
